intro: Diplostephium moranense, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is known for its milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks.
